David,
Check the docs out for more information on best practices here. They will give you a very good jump start on how to model and set navigation up in XbyK. While it's not exactly what is going to be released, it gives a very good example that will work for small sites and large sites.  
With the examples you can use taxonomy and even creat a crazy mega menu with images and 5 or 6 levels if you want. The only thing you can't do now is visualize it as you're building it in the content types. We no longer use the content tree to build even the simplest of navigation, it's all content hub items.
**<https://docs.kentico.com/tutorial/developer-tutorial/model-navigation>**
**<https://docs.kentico.com/tutorial/developer-tutorial/implement-navigation>**
